ai-tha-ap353:1.1_0: “I used to have a small sea
ai-tha-ap353:1.2_0: “In the wilderness, I’m sitting in the wilderness,
ai-tha-ap353:1.4_0: at the fore of the gods.
ai-tha-ap353:2.2_0: Having pulled out the great crowd,
ai-tha-ap353:3.1_0: the voice is the sage bearer of the Brahmā,
ai-tha-ap353:3.3_0: you should swep away the mind,
ai-tha-ap353:3.4_0: they’ve attained the ending of defilements.
ai-tha-ap353:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap353:4.4_0: This is the fruit of confidence.
ai-tha-ap353:5.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap353:6.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Mahā Moggallāna.
ai-tha-ap353:7.1_0: Seeing the first of the Elders
